section_intents: hook: motivate pointer arithmetic with a real array traversal scenario
concept: explain pointer arithmetic rules — incrementing past array bounds is UB
concept: array-to-pointer decay and what it means for function parameters
worked_example: traverse an int array using pointer arithmetic vs index notation
worked_example: pass array as pointer to function, show decay in action
pitfall: off-by-one in pointer arithmetic causes UB — show compiler warning and sanitizer output
concept: restrict qualifier — aliasing assumptions and when to use it
concept: const-correctness — const T* vs T* const vs const T* const
comparison: C const-correctness vs Rust borrow rules
bridge: connect pointer semantics to dynamic memory in the next exercise

file_intents: src/pointers.h: header with function declarations for pointer utility stubs
src/pointers.c: pointer arithmetic stubs — ptr_sum, ptr_find, ptr_reverse

case_intents: tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_sum returns correct sum over int array
tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_sum with single-element array
tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_find returns pointer to first match
tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_find returns NULL when element not present
tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_reverse reverses array in place
tests/test_pointers.c: test ptr_reverse on single-element array leaves it unchanged
tests/test_constness.c: test count_chars counts occurrences in a const string
tests/test_constness.c: test copy_restrict copies n bytes without overlap
tests/test_constness.c: test copy_restrict with length 0 is a no-op

exercise_description: Implement pointer arithmetic utilities (ptr_sum, ptr_find, ptr_reverse) and const-correct helpers (count_chars, copy_restrict), demonstrating array decay, const qualifiers, and restrict.
